intro: Clitandra kilimandjarica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Eastern Arc Mountains of Tanzania. It is characterized by its glossy,椭圆形 (elliptical) leaves that are dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside. The plant produces fragrant, yellowish-white flowers arranged in panicles, which bloom during the dry season. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Clitandra kilimandjarica is valued for its durable wood and is often found in moist, shaded habitats within montane forests.
